DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) for Myelodysplastic Syndromes Prognosis Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric rating of the International Prognostic Scoring System for myelodysplastic syndromes score.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) for Myelodysplastic Syndromes Prognosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A system for scoring myelodysplasia syndrome progression risk, based on a combination of: percentage of blast cells in the bone marrow, the presence and severity of specific cytogenetic abnormalities, and the number of cytopenias in the peripheral blood._The likely outcome or course of a disease; the chance of recovery or recurrence.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) for Myelodysplastic Syndromes Prognosis
Property.preferredDefinition: A system for scoring myelodysplasia syndrome progression risk, based on a combination of: percentage of blast cells in the bone marrow, the presence and severity of specific cytogenetic abnormalities, and the number of cytopenias in the peripheral blood.:(prog-NO-sis) The likely outcome or course of a disease; the chance of recovery or recurrence.

Concepts.longName: International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) for Myelodysplastic Syndromes
Concepts.definition: A system for scoring myelodysplasia syndrome progression risk, based on a combination of: percentage of blast cells in the bone marrow, the presence and severity of specific cytogenetic abnormalities, and the number of cytopenias in the peripheral blood.
Prediction of the probable course and outcome of a disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) for Myelodysplastic Syndromes Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system for scoring myelodysplasia syndrome progression risk, based on a combination of: percentage of blast cells in the bone marrow, the presence and severity of specific cytogenetic abnormalities, and the number of cytopenias in the peripheral blood._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Percent blasts: 20-30%; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3

Consists of 3 possible IPSS scores:
1) Percent blasts: 20-30%; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
2) Percent blasts: 20-30%; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3
3) Percent blasts: 11-20%; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3

Consists of 4 possible IPSS scores:
1) Percent blasts: 20-30%; Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q)); Cytopenias: 2-3
2) Percent blasts: 20-30%; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
3) Percent blasts: 11-20%; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
4) Percent blasts: 11-20; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3

Consists of 3 possible IPSS scores:
1) Percent blasts: 5 - 10%; Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q)); Cytopenias: 0.1
2) Percent blasts: <5%;  Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
3) Percent blasts: <5%;  Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q); Cytopenias: 2-3

Consists of 4 possible IPSS scores:
1) Percent blasts: <5%; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
2) Percent blasts: 5-10%; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
3) Percent blasts: <5-10%; Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q)); Cytopenias: 2-3
4) Percent blasts: <5; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3

Consists of 4 possible IPSS scores:
1) Percent blasts: 11-20%; Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q)); Cytopenias: 0-1
2) Percent blasts: 5-10%; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3
3) Percent blasts: <5-10%; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
4) Percent blasts: <5; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3

Consists of 4 possible IPSS scores:
1) Percent blasts: 20-30%; Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q)); Cytopenias: 0.1
2) Percent blasts: 11-20%; Karyotype: Intermediate (other abnormalities); Cytopenias: 0-1
3) Percent blasts: 11-20%; Karyotype: Good (normal, -Y, del(5q), del(20q)); Cytopenias: 2-3
4) Percent blasts: 5-10; Karyotype: Poor (complex, chrom 7 abnormalities); Cytopenias: 2-3
